abstract: While Michael S. Dell and Silver Lake strongly believe that their bid for the company is fair, they also appear to be daring the proxy advisory firm to recommend that shareholders vote against the deal.
snippet: While Michael S. Dell and Silver Lake strongly believe that their bid for the company is fair, they also appear to be daring the proxy advisory firm to recommend that shareholders vote against the deal.
lead_paragraph: As a shareholder vote on the proposed buyout of Dell Inc. approaches, its founder, Michael S. Dell, and the investment firm Silver Lake are standing firm, not raising their $24.4 billion offer.

headline.main: A Game of Chicken at Dell as a Proxy Adviser’s Report Looms
headline.print_headline: Founder and Silver Lake Decline to Raise Their $24 Billion Offer for Dell

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
